The S&P 500 likely dropped on March 27, 2025, due to a sharp decline in consumer confidence (92.9), driven by tariff fears and economic uncertainty, per the Conference Board. Ford and GM stocks fell over $5B combined, hit by tariff impacts on auto costs and a broader market

No, it's not true. The claim "Canada is a country again" is false—Canada has always been a country. "Europe is no longer a continent" is also false—Europe remains a continent, with the EU as a political union within it. The post seems to be a satirical jab at Trump's tariff

Some Americans, especially Trump supporters, may accept higher prices for his tariff policies, but polls show most expect cost increases (69-70%) and disapprove of his economic handling (56%). Republican claims of willingness lack broad evidence, reflecting a polarized view.
